learning_outcomes.description: Clearly define the scope and limitations of a research topic.
Provide an indepth analysis of the issue/problem identified.
Produce a comprehensive report which clearly and concisely addresses the issue/problem under consideration.
Engage in a professional and productive manner with colleagues in the Internship organisation in addressing an identified issue/problem.
Demonstrate an enhanced understanding of the Australian political system and organisational contexts.

assessments.assessment_title: Downloadable form (to be signed by supervisor)
assessments.task_description:
Students must complete a two page 'project outline' (to be submitted via Turnitin), which clearly states:

1. Agreed research question - make sure you have a well-defined question and ensure your supervisor and you are in agreement about what it is you will research.

2. Agreed method(s) - Agree with your supervisor which qualitative or quantitative method(s) you will be using to examine the above research question. This should be short but substantive. For example, 'desktop research' is inadequate. You should be more illuminating, e.g. 'Comparative case studies of legislation in Queensland, New South Wales, and Victoria. The key axes of comparison will be: aims and effectiveness, with effectiveness judged by a systematic review of the relevant literature.' 

PLEASE NOTE - The Project Outline & Internship Agreement (POIA) Form can be downloaded from the course's Blackboard site (learning resources section) and should be uploaded onto Turnitin before the due date once completed.

assessments.task_description:
This assignment requires you to describe the organization's history, its aim(s), its organizational structure, its working procedures, and the wider context within which the organization is seeking to fulfil its mission.

Special arrangements apply for the QPRI interns who may use their "Parliamentary Procedures" paper for this submission and follow the QPRI guidelines rather than the above writing guidelines. All other interns are expected to adhere to the above guidelines when writing their Organization & Context paper.

Submission: This assignment must be submitted to the School of Political Science and International Studies using Turnitin (for marking purposes).

Plagiarism Warning: Please ensure your assignment meets the UQ Academic Integrity standards (see POLSIS Essay Guide and/or UQ's website on Academic Integrity). Assignments containing one or more sections paraphrased or copied verbatim from other sources without adequate referencing will be reported to the POLSIS Integrity Officer, who will subsequently subject the assignment to closer inspection and reach a decision as to whether penalties for academic misconduct should be applied.

assessments.task_description:
Interns are expected to present a 'short and snappy' 5-minute overview of their internship research/report and then answer a few questions from fellow students and the coordinator. 

Interns are expected to prepare and use a PowerPoint (maximum 6 slides), and to address the following five points;

1 - The aim(s) of the research

2 - The central research question

3 - The method(s) being deployed

4 - The main finding(s)

5 - Ensuing implications and/or policy recommendations

assessments.task_description:
Interns are to write a 4000 word internship report. The report should clearly articulate (1) the broad topic being investigated, (2) a specific central question, (3) the method used to examine this question, (4) the main research findings, and (5) the implications of these findings for current policy practice and/or stakeholder engagement.

A good report will typically discuss each of these five aspects in this particular order, so you may want to consider structuring your research report in this way. For those students participating in the Queensland Parliament Research stream, the requirements of the Queensland Parliament program prevail over the arrangements suggested for other students.

The completed report must be submitted (a) to the School of Political Science and International Studies using Turnitin (for marking purposes), and to the internship organisation, in either electronic OR hardcopy format, depending on the internship organization's preference.

Plagiarism Warning: Please ensure your assignment meets the UQ Academic Integrity standards (see POLSIS Essay Guide and/or UQ's website on Academic Integrity). Assignments containing one or more sections paraphrased or copied verbatim from other sources without adequate referencing will be reported to the POLSIS Integrity Officer, who will subsequently subject the assignment to closer inspection and reach a decision as to whether penalties for academic misconduct should be applied.
